_header: Whoso will both well read and look
Subjects: masonry, craft of; didactic verse; instruction, religious; courtesy books
_description: ‘Constituciones artis gemetrie secundum Euclidem’ (a didactic-religious poem under the guise of instruction in the mason’s craft, with extensive borrowings from the Lay Folk’s Mass Book, 5537) — 98 lines in couplets

BLRoy17Ai.First Lines: Whoso wol boþe wel rede and lokeHe may fynde wryte yn olde boke…
BLRoy17Ai.Last Lines: …wel þys boke to come & redeHeuen to haue for ȝowre medeAmen amen so mot hyt beSay we so alle pur charyte
BLRoy17Ai.Note: A later transcript is London,  British Library Addit. 23198.
BLRoy17Ai.Attributed Title: Hic [   ] sunt constituciones artis gemetrie secundum Eucl[   ] (rubric, above first line, f. 1)
